Zions Bancorporation is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet ever-changing demands. Your ability to adapt, learn innovate and collaborate with a dynamic team helps us provide exceptional service to our customers and communities.

Our Workforce of the Future, DEI and UpSkilling initiatives allow you to network across the organization, volunteer in our community, and build your technical and soft skills. Together we are building a culture that values diversity, celebrates growth and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. Our people are what set us apart and make us great.

Operations and Infrastructure is core to our growing data analytics team. As a Sr. Data Operations Engineer, you will be playing an essential role in developing and deploying enterprise grade platforms that enable data-driven solutions. You are both a generalist, capable of picking up and working with multiple, disparate systems, and an expert, having an ability to dive deep into specific topics and quickly master them.

The Data Operation Engineering team at Zions Bancorp administers a Data Lake environment on Cloudera and highly motivated to begin its journey to the Cloud.


Evangelize and lead the team in Cloud and Data Operations best practices, ensuring delivery of a highly available and scalable systems

Can effectively communicate decisions, ideas, designs, and operation of systems and services to others in a clear and concise manner

Foster collaboration with software product development, architecture, and IT teams to ensure releases are delivered with repeatable and auditable processes

Build and deploy reproducible infrastructure via common Infrastructure as Code tooling (Ansible, SaltStack, Terraform…etc.)


Strong UNIX/Linux systems administration skills, including configuration, troubleshooting and automation

2+ years working with Big Data (e.g., Cloudera, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark)

2+ software development experience - languages (Java, Python, Shell Scripting)

Experience in continuous integration tools (Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins)

Strong experience configuring and/or integrating with monitoring and logging solutions such as syslog, ELK (Logstash, Kibana) and Kafka.

Experience deploying and operating services running in the Cloud (Google, Azure, AWS)

Strong understanding of Git (branching strategies, handling merge conflicts, pull requests)

Experience in continuous integration tools (Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, TFS, Maven, Nexus)

Strong understanding of networking concepts (troubleshooting, SSL configurations, VPC, subnets)

Engineering background, in either Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or Software Engineering


Experience with Docker, Kubernetes

Experience building data pipelines and automating Big Data platform applications/services

Experience Building/maintaining CI/CD pipelines in an enterprise setting

Variety of data stores/platforms (data warehouses/data marts, NoSQL)

A combination of education and experience may meet qualifications.

$130,000 – 160,000

This role may be eligible for a discretionary bonus.

This opportunity will be located in our brand new Zions Technology Center or can be 100% remote with the United States. We have a hybrid schedule of 3 days in the office and 2 days at home if you are within the Salt Lake area.

The Zions Technology Center is a 400,000-square-foot technology campus in Midvale, Utah. Located on the former Sharon Steel Mill superfund site, the sustainably built campus will be the company’s primary technology and operations center. This modern and environmentally friendly technology center will enable Zions to continue to compete for the best technology talent in the state while providing team members with an exceptional work environment with features such as:

Electric vehicle charging stations and close proximity to Historic Gardner Village UTA TRAX station.

At least 75% of the building is powered by on-site renewable solar energy.

Access to outdoor recreation, parks, trails, shareable bikes and locker rooms.

Large modern cafe with a healthy and diverse menu.

Healthy indoor environment with ample natural light and fresh air.

LEED-certified sustainable building that features include the use of low VOC-emitting construction material

About The Role

As a member of the Glacier Solutions Development (“GSD”) team, the Quality Assurance Lead reports to the Development Manager. The primary focus of this position is to manage test and perform quality assurance (QA) validation on business process solutions for assigned application(s) throughout the development lifecycle. This role will be responsible for provide leadership and technical direction for the development and support of our automated testing software, and test scripts used with the products built or enhanced and supported by the organization. In this role, you works with the product, development, and engineering teams, to create and implement a long-term vision, orchestrate high-quality system and solutions implementation, and maintain, guide, and improve architectural integrity and evolution of the testing system and tool set. May include testing support for workflow-driven system processes provided to the bank, such as Lending, Teller, New Accounts, Compliance, Quality Control, and Core Banking interface solutions. Ensures all relevant technical documentation is up to date. Performs and coordinates testing efforts to ensure testing completed by appropriate users at all levels of the organization for new systems, releases, new features, enhancements, and break/fix solutions. On project and strategic efforts, works in cross-functional teams to provide QA and testing support of new or current production systems. This position will be expected to work in and follow industry standard waterfall and agile development lifecycles. Adherence to structured software change and release management processes and procedures is required. This position will be considered a representative of the IT Department to all levels of bank groups and management, so professionalism and diplomacy to gain trust is critical to the success of the position.
